required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sirolimus-Eluting Stent vs. Intravascular Brachytherapy in In-Stent Restenotic Coronary Artery Lesions(SISR)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized Study of the Sirolimus-Eluting Bx VELOCITY® BALLOON Expandable Stent vs. Intravascular Brachytherapy in the Treatment of Patients With In-Stent Restenotic Coronary Artery Lesions

brief_summary.textblock: The main objective of this study is to demonstrate the superiority or non-inferiority of the sirolimus-eluting Bx VELOCITY® stent compared to intravascular brachytherapy in patients with in-stent restenotic native coronary artery lesions.

primary_outcome.measure: Target vessel failure (TVF) defined as cardiac death, myocardial infarction, or target vessel revascularization at 9 months post-procedure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Angiographic in-lesion and in-stent binary restenosis (³ 50% diameter stenosis) at 6 months post-procedure (by QCA).

Post-procedure and six-month in-stent and in-lesion percent diameter stenosis (%DS) and late loss at 6 months post-procedure (by QCA) - [analysis at 6 months chosen so that results from the GAMMA Trial can be used].
Post-procedure and six-month in-stent and in-lesion minimum lumen diameter (MLD) (by QCA).
Target lesion revascularization (TLR) at 6 and 9 months post-procedure.
Target vessel revascularization (TVR) at 6 and 9 months post-procedure.

Composite of Major Adverse Cardiac Events (MACE) defined as death, myocardial infarction (Q wave and non-Q wave), emergent bypass surgery, or repeat target lesion revascularization at 30 days and 6, 9, and 12-months, and 2, 3, 4, and 5 years post-proce
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days and 6, 9, and 12-months, and 2, 3, 4, and 5 years post-procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Stent lumen and stent obstruction volume by intravascular ultrasound (IVUS) at post-procedure and six months in a subset of patients conducted at 5-7 investigational centers.
Cost associated with the index hospitalization, length of stay, and repeat hospitalizations during the 12 mo post-procedure follow-up.

intervention.intervention_name: Sirolimus-Eluting Bx Velocity® Balloon Expandable Stent
intervention.description: Sirolimus-Eluting Bx Velocity® Balloon Expandable Stent

results_reference.citation: Holmes DR Jr, Teirstein P, Satler L, Sketch M, O'Malley J, Popma JJ, Kuntz RE, Fitzgerald PJ, Wang H, Caramanica E, Cohen SA; SISR Investigators. Sirolimus-eluting stents vs vascular brachytherapy for in-stent restenosis within bare-metal stents: the SISR randomized trial. JAMA. 2006 Mar 15;295(11):1264-73. Epub 2006 Mar 12.

Holmes DR Jr, Teirstein PS, Satler L, Sketch MH Jr, Popma JJ, Mauri L, Wang HP, Schleckser PA, Cohen SA; SISR Investigators. 3-year follow-up of the SISR (Sirolimus-Eluting Stents Versus Vascular Brachytherapy for In-Stent Restenosis) trial. JACC Cardiovasc Interv. 2008 Aug;1(4):439-48. doi: 10.1016/j.jcin.2008.05.010.
